item.title: 12 new Afelhem screenshots!
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

S!ms:

The landscapes do look a bit empty right? Just as KAL online
Nice screenies anywy, i can't wait to play your game (Just don't want to pay to test :))

Well.. They are in some areas but there are dense forests and stuff as well.

Read full topic

item.title: 12 new Afelhem screenshots!
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Making good graphics isnt the problem for most, its making good graphics compatible on low end machines. Runescape was deisgned to be able to play on all computers made within a decade or so... Because those with high-end computers dont play games like runescape, they play better games like WoW, or EQ.. etc.. Our game is inbetween, it is a game that your gonna need a failry good computer, but a crappy dell bought from the store with onboard video can even run it(but might be slow).

STH, I didn't say it wasn't working, It was working like a year ago and I meant we thought it wouldn't take long to build things in from there. But I under estimated how long it takes to add everything else in. We jumped into it too soon, i only did blitz3d for like 2 months and I got this stupid crazy idea to make a large game with it >.< Oh well I've gotten a lot better now

phr33 st00f pl0x, what is UT GOTY? Eithr way, nothign was ripped in these. Our previous screenies had stolen textures which we have removed now

Read full topic

item.title: 12 new Afelhem screenshots!
item.dc:creator: @Dizzy Dizzy
item.description:
@Dizzy wrote:

Wow. This makes me laugh at Jagex even more. The graphics are better than Runescape and your team is smaller then the Jagex team. And Jagex is rich! Don't you think they'd be able to afford some good graphic artists? Anyways, very good job. Can't wait till I get into game creating.

Read full topic

item.title: 12 new Afelhem screenshots!
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

jme_009:

[quote author=XxXFoRbIdDeNXxX link=topic=3940.msg38890#msg38890 date=1148750362]
Any Estimates about the RELEASE Date?

Sorry, but its just so damn hard to tell.

As soon as we had a stable working version of being able to run around and stuff i was thinking it would take 6 months, but oh man I was wrong. That was like a year ago, and now im thinking another year or more.[/quote]

Damn, I thought you had a working version?

Read full topic
